Package game

Class Summary
AutoCommand Represents the auto command.
Board A Jump61b board state.
BoardTest  
ClearCommand Represents the clear command typed at the terminal.
ClearToConnectCommand Represents the clear command recieved to signify that we are connected to a remote computer.
ClientPlayer A kind of Player that gets its commands from a remote program, and runs as a client of that remote program.
Command Command Parsing
CommandTest We test the Command implementation.
DumpCommand Represents the dump command.
FakeGame  
FakePlayer  
Game Represents the state of a game of Jump61b.
GameCommand Represents the game command from the local player.
GameTest  
GUIPlayer A kind of Player that reads its commands from a GUI and displays the state of the board.
HelpCommand Represents the help command.
HostCommand Represents the host command.
HostPlayer A kind of Player that gets its commands from a remote program, and runs as a host of that remote program.
HumanPlayer A kind of Player that reads its commands from the standard input.
JoinCommand Represents the join command from the terminal.
JumpingCubeBoard  
JumpingCubeFrame  
JumpingCubeStatusbar Shows a cool status bar below the board, giving handy info to the user.
LoadCommand Represents the load command
MachinePlayer A kind of Player that computes commands.
Main  
ManualCommand Represents the manual command, which counters auto.
MoveCommand Represents the move command as typed into the terminal.
NullCommand Represents an empty string input.
Player Represents one player in a game of Jump61b.
At any given time, each Player is attached to a Game and has a Color.
PlayersTest This JUnit Test Class checks the remote players.
QuitCommand Represents the quit command as issues by a local player, in both its manifestations during local or remote mode.
RemoteClearCommand Represents the clear command when recieved from a remote player.
RemoteGameCommand Represents the game command recieved from the remote computer.
RemoteMoveCommand Represents the move commands as received from remote players.
RemoteQuitCommand Represents the quit command as recieved from a remote player.
RemoteStartCommand Represents the start command as recieved from a remote host.
SeedCommand Represents the seed command.
StartCommand Represents the Start command as entered by the local user.
 

Enum Summary
Color Player and square colors for jump61b.
Game.State  
 

Exception Summary
ExitException An exception that indicates that the program should terminate.
